result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman R Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit for 240 days was granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Maintain part-time employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Norman R Thomas in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R Schmaus.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statements by Defendant.  Statement by J.Q.  

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months).  Credit for 240 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- DNA Sample ordered
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:   Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed and must be verified to Agent.   Maintain part-time employment and/or school.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
Filed by Attorney Schmaus-  Certificates of Completion of Programs and a letter indicating completion of programs while in Jail.
Sentencing hearing on February 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
